thread.title: 8 Things To Do in Staten Island's Neighborhoods This Weekend
thread.title_full: 8 Things To Do in Staten Island's Neighborhoods This Weekend

title: 8 Things To Do in Staten Island's Neighborhoods This Weekend
text:
8 Things To Do in Staten Island's Neighborhoods This Weekend By Nicholas Rizzi | April 28, 2016 4:33pm  18pm 
Where: Pride Center of Staten Island, 25 Victory Blvd., Tompkinsville When: 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. 
The Pride Center will host a screening of Meryl Streep's film "Florence Foster Jenkins," which follows an New York City heiress who wants to be an opera singer. A discussion will follow the film. 
Where: Art on the Terrace Gallery, 776 Richmond Terrace, Livingston When: Noon to 6 a.m. 
The SICC will host a reception for their open show celebrating the first anniversary of their Art on the Terrace Gallery. 
Where: Snug Harbor Cultural Center, 1000 Richmond Terrace, Livingston When: 1 to 3 p.m. 
Teaching artist ensemble Los Pleneros de la 21 will host a free, guided workshop on Puerto Rican percussion. The workshop, part of the Lincoln Center's Boro-Linc series, will also teach the basics of the Bomba dance. 
Where: Staten Island Museum, 1000 Richmond Terrace, Livingston When: 1 to 3 p.m. 
The Staten Island Museum continues its monthly family workshop with a class on creating noise makers. 
Where: Historic Richmond Town, 441 Clarke Ave., Richmond Town When: 6 to 8 p.m. 
Historic Richmond Town's series of acoustic concerts in the Guyon Tavern kicks off the series with performances by local jug band the Wahoo Skiffle Crazies . Tickets are $13 online, $15 at the door. 
Where: CPG Gallery, 814 Richmond Terrace, Livingston When: 8 p.m.
